project_description: A simple Flutter application that demonstrates the use of the Cubit pattern for state management. The app has one screen that shows a text 'Cat' with a clock icon. When the text is clicked, it switches to 'Dog' with a person icon.
architecture_overview: The project follows the Cubit pattern for state management, using a single Cubit to manage the state of the text and icon. The architecture is modularized with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, etc.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen : click()
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit : switchAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState : update state
AnimalState -> HomeScreen : notify state change
HomeScreen -> AnimalText : update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AnimalCubit manages the state of the animal text and icon. When the user clicks the text, the AnimalCubit switches the state, which triggers a UI update in the HomeScreen.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which is displayed when the app starts. There is no navigation to other screens.
